titles.title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide that the effective date of any changes in benefits under the Servicemen's Group Life Insurance program shall be based on the International Date Line.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1792)
Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1816)
Referred to the Subcommittee on Compensation, Pension and Insurance.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Veterans' Affairs. H. Rept. 103-199.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 111.

action.text: Mr. Montgomery moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans.

bill.summary: 8/2/1993--Passed House amended. Requires the effective date and time for any change in benefits under the Servicemen's Group Life Insurance program to be based on the date and time in the time zone immediately west of the International Date Line, with respect to benefit changes made after November 29, 1992.
